sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The arccosd function is used to find the arc cosine of an angle given in degrees. For example, arccosd (0.5) is 60.
sections.text_content: The arccosd function is used to find the arc cosine of an angle given in degrees. For example, arccosd (0.5) is 60.
sections.mdown_content: The **arccosd** function is used to find the arc cosine of an angle given in degrees. For example, **arccosd** (0.5) is 60.

sections.title: Example
code:
for i : -4 .. 4
            const arg := i / 4
            put "Arc cosine of ", arg, " is ",
                arccosd (arg), " degrees"
        end for
sections.raw_content: This program prints out the arccosine of values from -1 to 1 in degrees.
sections.text_content: This program prints out the arccosine of values from -1 to 1 in degrees.
sections.mdown_content: This program prints out the arccosine of values from -1 to 1 in degrees.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content:
the arcsind and arctand functions for calculating arcsine and arctangent

the arccos function which finds the arc cosine of a value with the result given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)

See also predefined unit Math.
sections.text_content:
the arcsind and arctand functions for calculating arcsine and arctangent
the arccos function which finds the arc cosine of a value with the result given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit Math.
sections.mdown_content:
the **[arcsind.html](arcsind)** and **[arctand.html](arctand)** functions for calculating arcsine and arctangent
the **[arccos.html](arccos)** function which finds the arc cosine of a value with the result given in radians. (2p radians are the same as 360 degrees.)
See also predefined unit **[mathmodule.html](Math)**.
